nodes.bodyText: How can it happen that the currentSubmissionComponent is not available?
why do we try to update? is the this.disconnected that unreliable?

Yes, it’s unreliable and if the student clicks on save we should at least try it.
Also the connection status shows the Websocket status, a Rest call could still work even if the Websocket is not connected (for whatever reason)

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -49,7 +49,9 @@

             "submitLastExercise": "Speichern",
             "greeting": "Hallo {{ fullName }}, willkommen zu \"{{ title }}\"",

+            "points": "Punkte",
+            "saveSubmissionError": "Die Änderungen konnten nicht gespeichert werden! Bitte stelle sicher, dass du online bist und speichere nochmal.",

nodes.bodyText: I think the wording of Möchtest du sicher fortfahren? is strange or unusual (maybe even misleading because "sicher" seems to describe the way how we continue), I couldn't find out that this is common (using Google) and DeepL suggests something like Bist du sicher, dass du fortfahren willst? which also sounds much more familiar and clear to me.

nodes.bodyText: Why do we need .bind(this) here? Is onSelectionChanged() not sufficient?
just copied from the other part. As it is working, I don't want to touch this ;-)
